projects.title: Tipplr
projects.description: Tipplr enables the user to filter a list of cocktail recipes based on what they actually have on hand in their personal inventory, add their own recipes, organize and save their favorites, and get recommendations on the next bottle they should add to their collection to significantly increase the number of drinks they can make at home. As part of  a team I was responsible for the JavaScript object and function architecture, local storage processes, inventory page function and DOM manipulation, and object alphabetization.

projects.title: Image Gallery
projects.description: This application displays images of and information about horned animals. This application allows the user filter the images by both a fuzzy search bar and by selecting the number of horns. By clicking an image a modal deploys and the animal is favorited.

projects.title: Code 201 Projects
projects.description: Personal projects built as part of the Code Fellows Code 201 course, where I developed various store front applications utlizing HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. The sites were made interactive through DOM manipulation, forms, and the chart.js API.
